boat.full_description:
The Sun Cat was designed as a “new breed of catboat”. A shoal-draft daysailer and overnighter that would rig quickly, sail easily, and comfortably accommodate family and friends with plenty of space for gear and stores.

Rob Cawley of Banbury ordered and imported the boat from Com-Pac Yachts in Clearwater, Florida, 2006 and named her Catsnip.

Gerrard Fraser-Williams purchased her in 2009 to sail out of Holyhead and Cemaes Bay, Anglesey.

Father and son Graham and Daniel Stoker purchased her in 2021 with the goal of trailer-sailing her from their home waters of SW Wales and NE Essex, as well as participating in OGA events.

Catsnip spent 2022 sailing on the Cleddau and then relocated to the River Colne in 2023.
boat.name: Catsnip
boat.short_description: A modern catboat originally imported from Florida.
